name: " Fading Path "
description:
An adventure game follows an unnamed young woman awakes in a lucid dream-like unnamed world filled with dark-reddish minimalistic backgrounds. Describe as an Anti-ARPG, a term used for subverting action role-playing game subgenre (without sidequests, minimaps, equipments, and usage of experience points), which was inspired by Anti-RPG.

The game features;

  • More exploration with action-oriented than story-driven elements
  • 8-directional movement
  • Lighting with shadow-based systems, as well as " Lantern " Item System
  • Little to no dialogue (except the tutorials)
  • Some or more enemies, no boss fights
  • No minimaps
  • PG 13-like moderate violence, no blood and gore
  • More creepy atmosphere from 3D / surround sounds through headphones, no background music
  • WASD for movement controls; JIKOLP and SHIFT for interact, toggle, and fight
  • Made with RPG Maker MV, but due to lack of character development including ARPG-like idle and fight animation, in which it stays for traditional RPG-Maker based systems
REQUIREMENTS
  • OS: Windows 7 / 8 / 10
  • Processor: Intel® Pentium® 4 2.0 GHz equivalent or faster processor
  • Memory: 2 GB
  • Graphics: GPU supporting OpenGL / WebGL
  • Storage: 250 MB available space

NOTE: The game was the second attempt from a previous proof-of-concept game, LIFE + DEATH, but some features were removed including a permadeath system. Unfortunately, HTML and PC platforms (primarily Linux and Mac) are no avail due to this game is Windows-exclusive only.
